channel.title: UK Wine Show
channel.description: The UK Wine Show is about wine and the UK wine scene, we interview winemakers, consumers, wine bar owners, scientists, you name it, if it is about wine, will be there. Almost all good wine from around the world wash up on these shores so well talk to those wines making a splash in the UK.

item.title: Nicola Jenkins of WRAP on recycling - 1
item.description: WRAP helps individuals, businesses and local authorities to reduce waste and recycle more, making better use of resources and helping to tackle climate change. We interview Helen Jenkins to find out how WRAP relates to the wine industry.

item.title: Recycling Wine Bottles with Paul McLavin of O-I
item.description: Owen-Illinois (O-I) is the largest manufacturer of glass containers in the world. We find out how recycled glass is used in the production of new glass with sales manager Paul McLavin.

item.title: Glass recycling with Gemma Scott of Richmond council
item.description: Gemma Scott is the recycling manager for London Borough of Richmond-upon-Thames council. We find out how glass is recycled in the borough.

item.title: Nyetimber with Eric Heerema and Cherie Spriggs
item.description: Nyetimber is one of the UK's leading sparkling wine producers. We meet with owner and CEO Eric Heerema and winemaker Cherie Spriggs.

item.title: Richard Balfour-Lynn on Balfour Rose
item.description: Richard Balfour-Lynn owns Hush Heath Estate in Kent and produces an award-winning sparkling rose. His main business interest lie in hotels and catering but we find out about his passion for wine.

item.title: Wine bottles with Paul McLavin from O-I
item.description: Owen-Illinois (O-I)is the largest manufacturer of glass containers in the world. We find out how wine bottles are manufactured with sales manager Paul McLavin.

item.title: Jean-Michel Laporte of La Conseillante on Pomerol
item.description: Chateau La Conseillante is one of the top producers in Pomerol, Bordeaux. We speak to general manager Jean-Michel Laporte about the Pomerol appellation and the wines of La Conseillante.

item.title: Bordeaux 2008 with Jean-Michel Laporte of La Conseillante
item.description: Chateau La Conseillante is one of the top producers in Pomerol, Bordeaux. Director Jean-Michel Laporte tells us about the 2008 vintage.

item.title: Michael Thompson on the Portman Group
item.description: The Portman Group regulates the UK drinks industry to encourage and challenge producers to promote their products responsibly. We talk with Michael Thompson, head of communications and external affairs.

item.title: WSTA Gavin Partington
item.description: Gavin Partington is spokesperson for The Wine and Spirit Trade Association that represents the whole of the wine and spirit supply chain in the UK. In this second interview with Gavin we find out about the WSTA and the issues they are tackling.

item.title: Liv-ex 100 index and trading with James Miles
item.description: James Miles is a founder and director of Liv-ex, the leading Fine Wine Exchange. In this final interview we talk about the Liv-ex 100 index.

item.title: Live-ex Bordeaux En Primeur campaign
item.description: James Miles is a founder and director of Liv-ex, the leading Fine Wine Exchange. In this second interview we follow the highs and lows of the last decade of en primeur campaigns in Bordeaux.

item.title: UK Wine Show 148 Liv-ex with James Miles
item.description: Liv-ex is the leading Fine Wine Exchange through which fine wines are traded between merchants as commodities. James Miles, founder and director, explains how the exchange works in the first of three interviews.

item.title: The Portman Group on minimum pricing with Michael Thompson
item.description: The Portman Group work with drinks producers to encourage and challenge them to promote alcohol responsibly. We discuss the issues around minimum pricing for alcohol.

item.title: Gavin Partington of the WSTA on minimum pricing
item.description: Gavin Partington is spokesperson for the Wine and Spirit Trade Association. In this interview we discuss the Scottish governments proposal to introduce a minimum price for alcohol.

item.title: Dr John Forrest on Waitaki Valley, New Zealand
item.description: Dr John Forrest of Forrest Estates has planted vineyards in the Waitaki Valley, a sub-region of Central Otago, New Zealand. John tells us about the region and the wines.

item.title: Elie Maamari of Chateau Ksara in Lebanon on the wines of Chateau Ksara
item.description: Elie Maamari of Chateau Ksara in Lebanon talks to us about the wines of Chateau Ksara.

item.title: Elie Maamari of Chateau Ksara on Lebanon
item.description: Elie Maamari of Chateau Ksara in Lebanon talks to us about the history of Lebanese wine production and the Bekka Valley region.

item.title: Wink Lorch on the Jura
item.description: Wink Lorch is a wine writer and educator as well as a specialist on the wine region of Jura in eastern France. A fascinating insight into the wines of the Jura and Vin Jaune, a style unique to the region.

item.title: Matthew Dickinson on Thierrys and France
item.description: Matthew Dickinson is commercial director at Thierrys Wine Services. Thierrys is the biggest UK importer of wine from France so we get a feel for their business and the French wine trade.

item.title: Neil Philips of Montana Wines
item.description: Neil Philips of Pernod Ricard is a brand ambassador for Montana Wines. We ask him about the Montana Terroir Series and how the different sub-regions of Marlborough produce different styles of Sauvignon Blanc.

item.title: China with Dr Richard Smart
item.description: Dr Richard Smart is a famous viticulturist who has been consulting on the Chinese wine industry. We find out more about China and its future as a wine-producing nation.

item.title: Will Davenport on Organic Wine
item.description: Will Davenport is the owner of Davenport Vineyards and has been growing organic grapes commercially since 2003. We catch up with him to find out why he went organic.

item.title: Jancis Robinson MW on Wine Education
item.description: Jancis Robinson MW is a world-leading wine writer with a weekly column in the FT. We ask her about her wine education and her advice for those wanting to further their own knowledge.

item.title: Xavier Rousset on food and wine matching
item.description: Xavier Rousset is an award-winning sommelier and owner of Texture restaurant in London. We catch up with Xavier to get his top tips on food and wine matching.

item.title: Josep Baujan on Cava and Yeast
item.description: Josep Baujan is technical director of Freixenet, the world-leading Cava and sparkling wine producer. In the second part of our interview we talk to Josep about yeast selection in Cava.

item.title: Josep Baujan of Freixenet on Cava
item.description: Josep Baujan is technical director of Freixenet, the world-leading Cava and sparkling wine producer. We talk to Josep about the history of Cava and the different styles.

item.title: Anna Lopez Lidon of Gramona on Cava
item.description: Anna Lopez Lidon is the export manager at Gramona, a Cava producer in Penedes, Spain. We discuss how Cava is produced, the dosage and the debate over international vs local grape varieties.

item.title: David Paxton on McLaren Vale
item.description: David Paxton is owner of Paxton Vineyards in McLaren Vale and one of Australia's best known viticulturists. David gives us a brief insight into the region and the grape varieties grown there.

item.title: Chris Unger of Yalumba on the Environment
item.description: Chris Unger is a sales manager for Negociants UK, the Australian owned importer of Yalumba. We talk with Chris about how Yalumba manage the environmental aspects of wine production.

item.title: Jancis Robinson on wine writing
item.description: Jancis Robinson is a world-leading writer and author of books including The World Atlas of Wine and the Oxford Companion. In this second interview we focus on her writing and what it involves.

item.title: Karen Wilson of Kingsland on bulk wine importing
item.description: Kingsland Wines and Spirits is the largest independent UK bottler of wines and spirits. Karen Wilson and Fiona Loveland explain how the process works and discuss the companys green initiatives.

item.title: Eduardo Beltran of Faustino on Rioja
item.description: Eduardo Beltran is the marketing director at Bodegas Faustino in Rioja, Spain. In this second interview we find out more about the wines of Rioja.

item.title: Eduardo Beltran of Faustino on Rioja
item.description: Eduardo Beltran is the marketing director at Bodegas Faustino in Rioja, Spain. We find out about Faustino and the wines of Rioja.

item.title: Bruce Walker of Vincor on wine regulation in Canada
item.description: Bruce Walker is a vice president of Vincor Canada and chairman of the Vintners Association. We chat to him about how alcohol and wine are regulated in the provinces of Canada.

item.title: Jancis Robinson MW
item.description: Jancis Robinson MW is a world-leading wine writer with a weekly column in the FT. We caught up with her and in the first of 3 interviews find out about a typical day in her life.

item.title: Peter Bohn of Weingut Schloss-Proschwitz on East Germany
item.description: Peter Bohn of Weingut Schloss-Proschwitz talks to us about wine production before and after the fall of the Berlin Wall.

item.title: Wines from the Goldtroepfchen, Germany
item.description: We speak with 2 producers, Gerhard Hahn from Kurt Hahn, Peter Lehnert from Lehnert-Veit and Ansgar Schmitz from Mosel wine production to find out more about the wines from the Goldtroepfchen region of Germany

item.title: Goldtroepfchen with Johann Haart and Manfred Breit
item.description: Johann Haart and Manfred Breit are vineyard owners in Goldtroepfchen in the Mosel. We find out about the area and why it is so unique.

item.title: Michael Adelmann on VDP wines
item.description: Michael Adelmann is a vice president of VDP, the Association of German Pradikat Wine Estates. We find out more about the VDP system for classifying Germany's finest wines.

item.title: Bernard Segway from INRA on Climate Change
item.description: INRA is the French National Institute for Agricultural Research. We speak with Bernard Segway on the potential effects of climate change on grape growing.

item.title: Tony Sharley of Banrock Station on Tetra Paks
item.description: Tony Sharley of Banrock Station tells us about the benefits of using tetra paks for wine.

item.title: Stephen Skelton on the UK Vineyards Guide 2008
item.description: Stephen Skelton MW is an expert on English wine and author of the UK Vineyards Guide 2008. We find out about the book and what's changed on the UK wine scene since the last edition was published in 2001.

item.title: Tim Finn of Neudorf Vineyards on UV Light
item.description: Tim Finn established Neudorf Vineyards 30 years ago in 1978 in the village of Neudorf, Nelson in New Zealand's South Island. Tim has been experimenting with UV light to achieve the perfect balance between flavour and sugar.

item.title: Mariela Molinari of Catena on altitude effects on wine
item.description: Bodega Catena Zapata has high elevation vineyards in Mendoza, Argentina producing world-class wines. We spoke to Mariela Molinari, assistant winemaker, to find out how altitude affects wine.

item.title: Dr Richard Smart on viticultural practice and myths
item.description: Dr Richard Smart is a world-leading viticulturalist and consultant on canopy management. In this second interview with Richard he explodes a few common myths on viticultural practices.

item.title: Sam Lindo of Camel Valley Vineyard
item.description: Sam Lindo is winemaker at the award-winning Camel Valley Vineyard in Cornwall. We find out about the family vineyard and the wines they're producing.

item.title: David Paxton on the Australian drought and water management
item.description: David Paxton is one of Australia's best known viticulturists and consultants. He founded Paxton Vineyards in McLaren Vale, South Australia in 1979. We ask him about the Australian drought and how water is being managed in McLaren Vale.

item.title: Carlos de Jesus from Amorim on Cork
item.description: Carlos de Jesus from Amorim, one of the largest cork producers in Portugal, talks to us about cork. We discuss corks past, present and future, and is protecting the environment and jobs the best reason for using cork?

item.title: Ian DAgata on Italian wine
item.description: Ian DAgata is an expert on regional Italian food and wine and managing director of the International Wine Academy of Rome. Ian gives an overview of the regions and key grape varieties to help get our heads around Italian wine.

item.title: Xavier Rousset on getting the best from your sommelier
item.description: Xavier Rousset is an award-winning sommelier and co-owner of Texture, the restaurant he opened in 2007. We talk with him about restaurant wine lists and his tips for getting the best from your sommelier.

item.title: Sam Harrop on Brettanomyces
item.description: Sam Harrop MW is a winemaker and an expert on all things wrong with wine. We talk to Sam about his analysis of wine faults at the International Wine Challenge, this week focusing on Brettanomyces.

item.title: Sam Harrop on winemaking faults and volatile acidity
item.description: Sam Harrop MW is a winemaker and an expert on all things wrong with wine. We talk to Sam about his analysis of wine faults at the International Wine Challenge, this week focusing on winemaking faults and volatile acidity.

item.title: Sam Harrop MW on wine faults and reduction
item.description: Sam Harrop MW is a winemaker and an expert on all things wrong with wine. We talk to Sam about his analysis of wine faults at the International Wine Challenge, focusing on reduction and sulphides.

item.title: Martin Fowkes of Three Choirs
item.description: Martin Fowkes is winemaker and director at Three Choirs, the leading single-estate vineyard in the UK. Martin looks back at the 2007 vintage when floods hit the region.

item.title: Charles Metcalfe and Mike Florence on the IWC
item.description: This week we are joined by Charles Metcalfe and Mike Florence of the International Wine Challenge to explain how the competition is run.

item.title: Joe Fattorini on the Scottish wine scene
item.description: Joe Fattorini is wine writer for The Herald in Glasgow. We talk with Joe about the wine scene in Scotland and why a respected journalist would risk it all to become a Master of Wine.

item.title: Bruce Walker of Vincor on Canadian Ice wine
item.description: Bruce Walker chairs the Canadian Vintners Association and is a VP of Vincor for government and industrial relations. We find out about the main Canadian wine regions and their world-famous Ice Wines.

item.title: Philip Shaw on the Orange Wine Region
item.description: Philip Shaw has been making wine in Australia for more than 4 decades and has his own vineyard in Orange, just west of Sydney. Philip tells us about the region and the wines he is producing.

item.title: Hugo Sharp and The Oz Wine Show
item.description: Hugo Sharp set up the first Australian wine podcast, The OZ Wine Show, in 2005. We caught up with him in Sydney to find out about the podcast and chat about Australian wine.

item.title: Ernst Loosen of the Dr Loosen Estate on Riesling
item.description: Ernst Loosen took over the Dr Loosen Estate from his father in 1988 and grows Riesling in the Mosel in Germany. We chat to Ernst about his world famous wine estate and Riesling.

item.title: Dr John Forrest of Forrest Estate on Riesling
item.description: Dr John Forrest is winemaker and owner of Forrest Estate in New Zealand and a big fan of Riesling. We find out why the versatile Riesling grape holds so much appeal.

item.title: Susy Atkins
item.description: Susy Atkins is an award-winning wine writer and broadcaster. She writes a weekly column for the Sunday Telegraph and is wine editor for Delicious magazine.

item.title: Tim Atkin MW on the French wine industry
item.description: Tim Atkin MW is wine critic and writer for The Observer. A passionate Francophile, Tim shares his views on the French wine industry and presents the highlights and opportunities.

item.title: Richard Smart Climate Change and Wine 4
item.description: Dr Richard Smart is a world-leading viticulturist and canopy management specialist. We ask how climate change will affect current wine regions.

item.title: Dr Hans Schultz Climate Change and Wine 3 Impact on Viticulture in Europe
item.description: Dr Hans Schultz is Professor at the Department of Viticulture in The Geisenheim Research Institute of Germany. He has researched the impact of climate change on Viticulture and talks about how increasing temperatures might affect grape-growing in Europe.

item.title: Greg Jones Climate Change and Wine 2 Climatology
item.description: Greg Jones is a Professor of Climatology at the University of Oregon in the United States. We talk about the big picture for climate change and what it means for the wine industry.

item.title: Pancho Campo Climate Change and Wine 1 Introduction
item.description: Pancho Campo of the Wine Academy of Spain is the organiser of the International Conference on Climate Change and Wine. We caught up with Pancho on the eve of the conference to discuss the key messages.

item.title: Ernst Loosen on German Wine
item.description: The Dr Loosen estate has been in the Loosen family for 200 years. Ernst Loosen took over in 1988 and has been creating world-class wines ever since. We find out why Ernst believes German wine is hot right now.

item.title: Phil Laffer of Jacobs Creek on managing alcohol in winemaking
item.description: Phil Laffer, winemaker at Jacobs Creek, talks about how the company has set a goal to reduce the alcohol levels of their wines to below 14% abv.

item.title: Greg Hay on the Otago, New Zealand
item.description: Greg Hay of Peregrine Wines set up Chard Farm in Central Otago in 1986. We find out how the Otago wine region divides up and how Greg has been played his part in its success.

item.title: Olly Smith
item.description: Olly Smith has been presenting wine on British television since 2005 when he won Hardys Wine Idol competition. He appears on BBC Saturday Kitchen and the Richard and Judy Wine Club. We chat to him about what he gets up to and why he loves it so much.

item.title: Tim How on the Majestic Retail Management Programme
item.description: Tim How is CEO of Majestic Wines. Each year they recruit around 150 people onto their Retail Management Programme. We ask Tim about the programme and the opportunities for career progression at Majestic.

item.title: Harpers Podcast 1 New Zealand wine growers
item.description: The first Harpers' podcast, sponsored by New Zealand Winegrowers and produced by the UK Wine Show, gives behind-the-scene insight in a round-table discussion with Philip Gregan and producers from Trinity Hill, Neudorf and Felton Road take part.

item.title: Wine MBA at the Royal Agricultural College
item.description: Nikki Garrett runs wine modules as part of the Wine MBA at the Royal Agricultural College, Cirencester. We find out what's involved in this course that equips graduates for careers in the wine industry.

item.title: 85 Greg Hay on Sustainable Viticulture
item.description: Greg Hay of Peregrine Wines has been involved in the Central Otago wine industry for 21 years. We talk to him about the Peregrine winery and the New Zealand sustainable wine programme.

item.title: Blair and Estelle Hunt on Sustainable Viticulture
item.description: Blair and Estelle Hunt of Bald Hills,Central Otago have recently won an international award for sustainable viticulture. We ask what it means to be sustainable in the clean, green land we call New Zealand.

item.title: Blair and Estelle Hunt of Bald Hills Central Otago
item.description: Blair and Estelle Hunt own Bald Hills in Central Otago, New Zealand. Their 2005 Pinot Noir scooped Champion Red at the International Wine Challenge in 2007 attracting huge interest. We visited the vineyard to find out more.

item.title: Harpers with editor Richard Siddle
item.description: Richard Siddle is editor at Harpers Wine and Spirit magazine and was brought on board for the relaunch in 2007. We find out about the new magazine and the changes that have been made.

item.title: Tasting Buddy with Paul Fitzpatrick
item.description: Tasting Buddy is a tool to enable the flow of information about a bottle of wine from the producer to the end user. Founder Paul Fitzpatrick explains how it is starting to be utilised by the trade at tastings and shows.

item.title: Tim Atkin MW 2007 Wine Communicator of the Year
item.description: Tim Atkin MW is a leading wine writer in the UK and has been writing for The Observer since 1993. He won the 2007 IWSC Wine Communicator of the Year award in recognition of his contribution to wine education. We catch up with Tim to find out more.

item.title: Rozes winemaker Antonio Saraiva
item.description: Antonio Saraiva is winemaker and general manager for Port house Rozes. We find out about the vineyards and terroir of the Douro region.

item.title: Rozes Port with Sarah Hicks
item.description: Sarah Hicks, Sarah is the UK Manager for Vranken Pommery Monopole. They are the people behind Port house Rozes and Sao Pedro das Aguias. We talk to her about Rozes and which is more important - history or innovation.

item.title: aBecketts Vineyard Paul Langham
item.description: aBecketts Vineyard in Wiltshire was established by Paul Langham and wife Lynn in 2001. With 6 acres under vine of 5 grape varieties they're producing some interesting styles of English wine. Paul tells us about growing grapes on the Salisbury Plain.

item.title: Robert Joseph
item.description: Robert Joseph is a renowned wine expert and writer and the man responsible for launching the International Wine Challenge awards back in 1984. We talk to him about his latest book, his new wines and the emergence of new latitude wines.

item.title: Murray McHenry of McHenry Hohnen Vintners
item.description: McHenry Hohnen Vintners is a family owned wine producer sourcing grapes from four vineyards in Margaret River. We catch up with Murray McHenry to hear how their natural approach to growing grapes is reaping rewards.

item.title: Mike Ratcliffe Grape Varieties in South Africa
item.description: South Africa is known for Pinotage but there are other grapes coming through including Shiraz and Sauvignon Blanc. We talk to Mike Ratcliffe about the trends in new plantings.

item.title: Neal Martin on wine ratings
item.description: Neal Martin is a wine writer for Robert Parker and uses the The Wine Advocate Rating System to evaluate quality. We get to grips with the worlds most famous and powerful wine rating system and the pros and cons of wine ratings.

item.title: The Wine Show with Alicia Coughlan and Charlie Connor
item.description: The Wine Show is a consumer exhibition held at the Business Design Centre in Islington. We catch up with the organisers to find out whats on at this year's show.

item.title: Neal Martin on wine writing
item.description: Neal Martin writes for Robert Parker, the renowned American wine commentator to give a British perspective to the erobertparker.com website. We hear how Neal first created his own successful wine site and how his distinctive writing style sets him apart.

item.title: Tim How of Majestic on wine retailing
item.description: Tim How is CEO at Majestic Wine Warehouses winner of the 2007 Decanter award for Best High Street Retailer. Tim describes Majestic's positioning in the UK and how they compete so successfully.

item.title: Mike Rogers of Philglas and Swiggot
item.description: Mike Rogers is co-owner of award-winning independent wine merchant Philglas and Swiggot. Established in 1991 there are now 3 stores in London. Mike gives an insight into retailing wine at the quality end of the spectrum.

item.title: Waitrose Justin Howard-Sneyd MW
item.description: Justin Howard-Sneyd is head of wine buying at Waitrose and is one of 5 MWs in the team. Justin explains how Waitrose position their in-store wine departments to appeal to a broad range of customers.

item.title: Mike Ratcliffe on black empowerment in South Africa
item.description: Mike Ratcliffe is Deputy Chairman of South African Wine Industry Trust. We talk about black economic empowerment and how the trust is helping disadvantaged people to get into the wine industry.

item.title: Mike Ratcliffe Wines of South Africa
item.description: Mike Ratcliffe is a director of Wines of South Africa and managing director of Warwick Estate. Mike talks to us about future plans for South African wines.

item.title: Steve Smith Craggy Range on Terroir
item.description: Steve Smith is a Master of Wine, viticulturist and managing director of Craggy Range, New Zealand. We find out what he thinks about terroir and why variety, climate and soil matter.

item.title: Louis Latour on Terroir and Global Warming
item.description: Louis Latour of Burgundy negociant Maison Louis Latour gives us his thoughts on the concept of terroir and the impact of global warming in his part of France.

item.title: Wine Marketing with Michael Cox
item.description: Michael Cox launched Oxford Landing amidst the onslaught of fruit-driven Australian wines arriving in the UK in the 80's and 90's. We talk with Michael about the challenges of marketing New World wines.

item.title: Wine for Spice with Warren Edwardes
item.description: Wine for Spice was created to extinguish that burning question of the ideal wine to drink with curry. We catch up with Wine for Spice founder Warren Edwardes for a lesson in spicy food and wine matching.

item.title: Louis Latour on Burgundy negociants
item.description: Maison Louis Latour is one of the most highly-respected negociants in Burgundy. We speak to Louis Latour about the activities of a negociant and their role in producing and selling Burgundy's wine.

item.title: Sioban Harnett Viticulturist at Cloudy Bay Part 2
item.description: Sioban Harnett is viticulturist at Cloudy Bay, the iconic New Zealand winery. We find out how the vines are trained and managed to suit the growing conditions of the Marlborough region.

item.title: Tim How CEO of Majestic Wines
item.description: Tim How is CEO of Majestic Wines, the UK's biggest chain of wine warehouses. Tim looks back at Majestic's history and forward to ambitious plans for future growth.

item.title: Sioban Harnett Viticulturist at Cloudy Bay Part 1
item.description: Sioban Harnett is the viticulturist at Cloudy Bay, New Zealand's iconic winery. We talk about the different jobs of a viticulturist throughout the growing season.

item.title: Simon Waghorn on Wine Awards
item.description: Simon Waghorn is winemaker for Whitehaven and Astrolabe, two top award-winning New Zealand wine brands. We get his views on wine awards and how winnning can help sell wine.

item.title: Michael Cox Wines of Chile
item.description: Wines of Chile is a promotional body that represents 90 Chilean wineries with offices in Santiago and London. Michael Cox heads up the UK office which was set up in 2003. We asked him for his perspective on Chilean wine.

item.title: Mark Hallett Grape Escapes
item.description: Mark Hallett is owner of Grape Escapes a wine tour operator specialising in wine holidays to the vineyard regions of France. We find out what their tours to Champagne have to offer.

item.title: Tony Jordon CEO of Green Point
item.description: This week we feature Tony Jordon the CEO of Green Point Australia on the recent release of their entire sparkling range under crown seal.

item.title: Julia Trustram Eve English Wine Producers
item.description: This week is English Wine Week so we met up with Julia Trustram Eve, Marketing Manager for English Wine Producers, the Marketing Association for the English Wine Industry. We discuss issues including new Brussels legislation and global warming.

item.title: Denbies Wine Tourism with Chris White
item.description: Denbies is England's largest vineyard and attracts 300,000 visitors a year. General Manager and son of the owner, Chris White, lets us in on the secret of Denbies' success.

item.title: James Booth Virtual Wine
item.description: James Booth is co-founder of Virtual Wine, the wine media company that runs wine tastings over the Internet. We find out how a virtual wine tasting works and why the idea is catching on.

item.title: Wine Closures with Jamie Goode
item.description: Jamie Goode is the wine writer and blogger behind wineanorak.com. In this interview we discuss the technical issues with a range of closures including the screwcap, natural cork, diam, zork and the vino lock.

item.title: George Bowden Leventhorpe Winery
item.description: Leventhorpe Winery is a commercial vineyard and winery based in Leeds in the North of England. Owner George Bowden tells how he grows vines at the extreme edge of viticulture and why badgers, birds and hedgehogs are as much a hazard as frost and fungi.

item.title: Wine Storage Cabinets
item.description: Two competing manufacturers of wine cabinets are Dometic Wine Cellars and Liebherr. Each use very different technology to store wine so we find out how they work and explore the pros and cons.

item.title: Lucy Hargreaves Spiral Cellars
item.description: Lucy Hargreaves is co-owner of Spiral Cellars, a company who specialise in home wine storage. We find out how the Spiral Cellar system works and how it rivals the traditional cellar.

item.title: Claire Wood Two Hands Horizontal Tasting Part 2
item.description: Two Hands Wines was established in 1999 with the objective of making the best possible Shiraz based wines from prized Shiraz regions in Australia. In part 2 we taste 3 wines from 3 regions in a horizontal tasting.

item.title: Claire Wood Two Hands Horizontal Tasting Part 1
item.description: Two Hands Wines was established in 1999 with the objective of making the best possible Shiraz based wines from prized Shiraz regions in Australia. In part 1 we compare 3 wines from 3 regions in a horizontal tasting.

item.title: Richard Selley Geology and Wine Part 2
item.description: Richard Selley is a Professor of Geology and a Senior Research Fellow at Imperial College, London. In Part 2 we explore the different soil types in vineyards across the UK.

item.title: Richard Selley Geology and Wine Part 1
item.description: Richard Selley is a Professor of Geology and a Senior Research Fellow at Imperial College, London. He explains how the different soil and rock types affect the vines that are grown on them.

item.title: Matt Skinner
item.description: Australian-born Matt Skinner is sommelier at Jamie Oliver's Fifteen restaurant and a well-known personality in the UK wine world. Matt tells us how he got to where he is today, starting 13 years ago in an Aussie bottle shop.

item.title: Joel Peterson on the Zinfandel grape
item.description: Joel Peterson is founder of Ravenswood, the largest producer of Zinfandel in the world. In this second interview with Joel we discuss the latest genetic research into the origins of the Zinfandel grape.

item.title: Joel Peterson of Ravenswood Winery
item.description: Joel Peterson is founder of Ravenswood in Sonoma, California. Ravenswood is the largest producer of Zinfandel in the world and is now owned by Constellation Brands. Find out why Joel is so passionate about Zinfandel and how he became the 'King of Zin'.

item.title: Nicholas Ingham Fairtrade Wine
item.description: As Fairtrade Fortnight approaches we talk to Nicholas Ingham of Fairtrade wine importers Grape-2-Wine and find out how the Fairtrade foundation can help producers in developing countries to get a better deal for their wines.

item.title: Jamie Goode on Wine Science
item.description: This week we talk to Jamie Goode about his book, Wine Science, and wine blog and website, wineanorak.com.

item.title: Parri Estate and Fleurieu Peninsula
item.description: This week we talk to Michael House from Parri Estate in the Fleurieu Peninsula, Australia. We discover the differences between the Fleurieu Peninsula and neighbouring McLaren Vale region.

item.title: Jamie Goode on wine faults
item.description: Jamie Goode is an expert in the science of winemaking. His book Wine Science provides an indepth reference for wine producers across a range of issues. In this interview we explore common wine faults such as Brettanomyces and volatile acidity.

item.title: Richard Selley Global Warming and Wine in Britain
item.description: Richard Selley is a Professor of Geology and a Senior Research Fellow at Imperial College, London. He is author of The Winelands of Britain and shares with us his knowledge on climate change in Britain relating to wine.

item.title: Isabelle Legeron on the Master of Wine programme
item.description: Isabelle Legeron from Wine Labs is studying for her Master of Wine. Find out how Isabelle has found the course, what her motivations are and the rewards she hopes an 'MW' may bring.

item.title: Chris Foss, Plumpton College
item.description: Chris Foss is Head of Wine Studies at Plumpton College in Sussex. He is half-French and Bordeaux-trained. Chris brings us up to speed on the wine courses on offer at Plumpton.

item.title: Ian Harris, Wine and Spirit Education Trust
item.description: Ian Harris is Chief Executive of the Wine and Spirit Education Trust (WSET). He has been in the wine trade for 30 years and joined WSET in 2002. We find out what's on offer and how Ian has instigated change.

item.title: Roger Corder, The Wine Diet
item.description: Roger Corder is the author of a new book, The Wine Diet. He sets out to explain the health benefits of red wine and how drinking in moderation, with food, may help lower the risk of heart-related disease. Roger asks are all red wines equal?

item.title: Aged Semillon with Phil Ryan, Mount Pleasant
item.description: Phil Ryan is Chief Winemaker at Mount Pleasant in Hunter Valley and has been with parent company McWilliams for 41 years. Phil takes us through a vertical tasting of Semillons and explains how the wine's character changes as it ages.

item.title: Taylor's Port with Rod Smith MW, Mentzendorff
item.description: Rod Smith MW explains the different port styles made by top producer Taylor's and how to store and serve it. We taste Taylor's 1985 Vintage Port to discover how it has aged over the past 21 years.

item.title: Matthew Jukes
item.description: Wine expert Matthew Jukes writes the Daily Mail wine column and his Top 250 is the UKs no.1 wine guide. We talk about life as a wine writer and get Matthew's recommendations for Christmas 2006 drinking.

item.title: Mt Difficulty Michael Herrick
item.description: Mt Difficulty is a top producer of Pinot Noir in Central Otago, New Zealand. Michael Herrick talks to us about the wines being produced at Mt Difficulty and techniques employed in the vineyard.

item.title: Simon Waghorn, Astrolabe and Whitehaven winemaker
item.description: Simon Waghorn has 20 years experience as a winemaker. In 1995 he began making wine for Whitehaven in Marlborough and now has his own label, Astrolabe. We discover the differences in style between the two brands and the winemakers influence.

item.title: Oz Clarke UK Wine Communicator of the year
item.description: Oz Clarke is one of wine world's best known personalities and is Wine Communicator of the Year for 2006. He is back on TV on 22 November with a six-part BBC series 'Oz and James's Big Wine Adventure'.

item.title: Ridgeview and the 2006 English Harvest Mike Roberts
item.description: Mike Roberts is the owner of Ridgeview Estate, a top English sparkling wine producer. His wines consistently win international awards so what makes them so successful and able to compete with Champagne?

item.title: The Zork! John Brooks from Zork
item.description: Zork is a revolutionary wine closure that seals like a screwcap and pops like a cork. It has been developed to help solve the problem of cork taint and random oxidation associated with natural corks. John Brooks, co-founder of Zork, explains the benefits.

item.title: The Frenchman's generic generic and Chris Skyrme from Sopexa
item.description: Sopexa work with the French generic bodies to promote French wines as a whole. Chris Skyrme brings us up to speed with how they are promoting their wines to the UK consumer.

item.title: Wine Show Preview with Isabelle Legeron and Chris Skyrme from Sopexa
item.description: This week we preview The Wine Show with wine expert Isabelle Legeron and head of PR for the French Wines Experience, Chris Skyrme. The Wine Show is on from 26-29 October 2006 at the Islington Business Design Centre in London.

item.title: Granite Belt Australia's least known wine region Leanne Gangemi Ballandean
item.description: The Granite Belt in Queensland, Australia is at 28 degrees latitude - outside the normal range for growing grapes. Chris met up with Leanne Gangemi of Ballandean winery to find out how they are able to successfully make good wine.

item.title: Organic wine, Steve Caracatsanoudis, Robinvale
item.description: Steve Caracatsanoudis runs Robinvale Organic Wines with his brother Bill. Their biodynamic vineyards were established in 1980 in Victoria, Australia. We find out how bio-dynamic farming puts life into the soil, the grapes and ultimately, the wine.

item.title: Organic wine, Lance Pigott Vintage Roots
item.description: Lance Pigott is a founder of Vintage Roots, the UK's leading organic wine company. We catch up with him to find out about a thriving organic wine industry that includes biodynamic, vegan and sulphur-free wines.

item.title: The UK Wine Consumer, Richard Halstead of Wine Intelligence
item.description: Richard Halstead of Wine Intelligence provides an insight into how UK consumers approach wine, revealing our attitudes and behaviour when it comes to buying and drinking the stuff.

item.title: The intelligence behind wine, Richard Halstead of Wine Intelligence
item.description: We get the lowdown from Richard Halstead of Wine Intelligence on market research into wine and the wine industry. In the first of two interviews with Richard catch up on the latest trends on the UK high street.

item.title: Decanter Awards
item.description: In our second interview with Decanter we talk to Clare Seel about the Decanter World Wine Awards. The 2006 results are just out providing wine drinking recommendations for consumers across the globe.

item.title: Decanter The UK's leading wine magazine
item.description: This week we interview Guy Woodward and Adam Lechmere at Decanter, the UK's top wine consumer magazine. We find out who is reading it and what to expect inside the covers.

item.title: The wine show preview
item.description: The Wine Show was launched in 2005 at the Business Design Centre in Islington. 12,000 consumers attended, making it one of the largest wine focused shows in the UK. We talk to the people behind the show and see what they have in store for us this year.

item.title: Pieter Ferreira from Graham Beck wines on winemaking in South Africa part 2
item.description: Pieter Ferreira, winemaker at Graham Beck, tastes three wines with us and explains how they are made. Find out why he makes sparkling wines in barrels and how he prefers his barrels burnt on the inside to a medium toast!

item.title: Pieter Ferreira from Graham Beck wines on winemaking in South Africa part 1
item.description: In a two part series we talk with Pieter Ferreira winemaker at Graham Beck, one of South Africa's top sparkling wine producers. Peter talks about South African wine industry social responsibility and Nasa satellites.

item.title: Huw Gott from The Marquess Tavern
item.description: In the last of our three part series we speak to Huw Gott of gastro pub, The Marquess Tavern, to find out about their wine list and the wines people are drinking this summer.

item.title: Wine buyer Mathew Cooper from Ellis of Richmond
item.description: This week is the second in a three part series looking behind the scenes at restaurant wines. Matthew Cooper, wine buyer at Ellis of Richmond, reveals some of the differences between restaurant and supermarket wines.

item.title: James Ellis from Ellis of Richmond
item.description: We talk to James Ellis of Ellis of Richmond, supplier of wine to the independent restaurant trade, and pick up tips on what to look out for on wine lists.

item.title: Ant Mackenzie from Spy Valley
item.description: New Zealand wines have the highest average price in the UK market. Ant Mackenzie, chief winemaker at Spy Valley talks about New Zealand's largest and most famous wine region, Marlborough, and gives us his perspective on sustainable viticulture.

item.title: Riedel how the glass changes the wine
item.description: Riedel's glass making history dates back to 1678. We find out how the shape, size and quality changes your wine drinking experience.

item.title: Wines from Germany
item.description: As the nation is gripped by World Cup fever we explore how German wines are faring in the UK with Lisa Grimley from Wines of Germany.

item.title: Closures, Pieter Ferreira of Graham Beck updates us
item.description: Natural cork, plastic or screwcap? They all seal the bottle but which wine closure is best? This week we hear from Pieter Ferreira of Graham Beck with the latest on this hot debate.

item.title: Owen Elias from Chapel Down
item.description: Owen Elias from Chapel Down talks to us about winemaking in the UK and how the industry has changed over the last decade from amateur hobbyist to professional business.

item.title: Dermot Sugrue Nyetimber
item.description: We interview Nyetimber's winemaker, Dermot Sugrue. Dermot is an effervescent character from Ireland producing England's top sparkling wines.

item.title: Chris Scott Introduces the UK Wine Show
item.description: This first show gave me great satisfaction to finally get completed. It gives an overview of the show's format and a taste of things to come.
